info.title: Olive Option API
info.description:
Welcome to the Olive Option API documentation! This API serves as the backbone for the Olive Option platform, enabling seamless interactions with our services and functionalities. Through this API, developers can manage users, process transactions, and access a wide range of options-related data, making it an essential tool for building applications that integrate with our platform. 

Key features include:
- **User Management**: Create, read, update, and delete user accounts with ease.
- **Transaction Processing**: Handle financial transactions securely and efficiently.
- **Options Data Access**: Retrieve real-time information on various options available on our platform.

To get started, explore the various endpoints available in this documentation. You can also [download the Swagger JSON](https://api-oliveoption.up.railway.app/swagger.json) for a comprehensive view of the API structure. Our API is designed with ease of use and flexibility in mind, providing you with the necessary tools to integrate and enhance your applications. Happy coding!

Bearer.name: Authorization
Bearer.description: JWT Authorization header using the Bearer scheme. Example: `Authorization: Bearer {accessToken=<token>;refreshToken=<token>}`

post.description: Creates a new affiliate user.
Authenticates an affiliate user and provides an access token.
Logs out an affiliate user by invalidating the token.
Verifies an affiliate user's email using a verification code.
Verifies an affiliate user's OTP using a verification code.
Resends a verification code to the provided email for account verification.
Resends a verification code to the provided email for password reset.
Sends a one-time password (OTP) to the user for password change.
Changes the user's password using the OTP and new password.
Refreshes the access token using the provided refresh token.

get.description: Fetches a paginated list of affiliate users with optional filtering and sorting.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number to retrieve (1-based index).

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The number of records to retrieve per page.

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: Optional filters for the results. Expected structure: { active: boolean, searchQuery: string, sortBy: string, sortOrder: string, tier_level: string, total_referrals: number }

parameters.name: filters

get.description: Retrieve the activities for the logged-in user, with optional filters.

parameters.name: activityType
parameters.description: The type of activity to filter by. The activity type can be one of the following types: sign_in, sign_up, password_change, account_verification, referral_signup, logout. Each activity type represents a distinct user action within the affiliate tracking system.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records per page.

400.description: Invalid referral code or missing parameter.

post.description: Create a new promo code (requires authentication)

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Payload for creating a new promo code. This should include the code, expiry date, usage limit, discount amount, and activation status. The promo code must be unique and 3 digits long because a unique 4-digit code will be attached to it, making its total length 7. The expiry date should be set in the future. The usage limit defines how many times the promo code can be used, while the discount amount specifies the monetary value of the discount to be applied.

get.description: Get a promo code by ID (requires authentication and validates ID)

put.description: Update a promo code by ID (requires authentication and validates ID)

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Payload for updating an existing promo code. This should include the promo code details that need to be updated, such as the expiry date, usage limit, discount amount, and activation status. All fields are optional; however, at least one field must be provided to perform the update. The promo code itself remains unchanged unless specifically included in the payload.

delete.description: Delete a promo code by ID (requires authentication and validates ID)

post.description: Validate a promo code (requires authentication)
Create a new affiliate link (requires authentication)

get.description: Fetch a paginated list of affiliate links (requires authentication)

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number to fetch (1-based index). Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The number of records to fetch per page. Defaults to 10.

parameters.name: searchQuery
parameters.description: Optional search term to filter results by affiliate link fields (e.g., link, comment, etc.).

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Optional field to sort the results by (e.g., created_at, link). Defaults to created_at.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: Optional sorting order: ASC for ascending, DESC for descending. Defaults to DESC.

parameters.name: affiliateProgramId
parameters.description: Optional filter to return affiliate links associated with a specific affiliate program ID.

post.description:
Create a new Affiliate Telegram link (requires authentication). Acceptable user types are: AffiliateUser, Staff, or User.

Frontend to Backend Request: The frontend request (linkTelegramAccount function) notifies the server of the user's intent to link their Telegram account. It includes the userId, userType, and authentication tokens needed for backend verification.

Backend Response & User Action: After receiving the request, the backend responds with a deep link to the Telegram bot (e.g., https://t.me/olive_cherry_bot). The user must click this link to initiate the linking process in Telegram.

Telegram Bot Interaction:

  • When the user clicks the bot link, Telegram opens, and the user can send one of the following commands to link or unlink their account:
    • /start - Start the bot interaction.
    • link my account / link account / link - Link the users account.
    • /unlink / no / not now / cancel - Unlink the users account.
  • The backend listens for these commands from the Telegram webhook, processes the action, and completes or cancels the link based on the users input.

After the Telegram interaction, the frontend can make a GET request to /affiliate/telegram/ with the token to verify the link status and update the UI accordingly.

Acceptable user types:

  • AffiliateUser Represents an affiliate user.
  • Staff Represents an internal staff member.
  • User Represents a regular user in the system.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Payload for creating a new Affiliate Telegram link, including the user type. Valid user types are: AffiliateUser, Staff, or User.

post.description: Creates a new activity record. The activity can be one of the following types: SIGN_IN, SIGN_UP, PASSWORD_CHANGE, ACCOUNT_VERIFICATION, REFERRAL, LOGOUT. Each activity type represents a distinct user action within the affiliate tracking system.

400.description: Bad Request. This response indicates that the provided data is invalid or missing required fields.

401.description: Unauthorized. The request lacks valid authentication credentials.

403.description: Forbidden. The user does not have permission to perform this action.

500.description: Internal Server Error. An unexpected error occurred while processing the request.
